radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral diffuse reticular and granular opacities, normal lung volumes.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: On the second day, mild increase in lung volumes, reticular and granular opacities persisted. On the third day, changes consistent with pulmonary edema and increased cardiac silhouette; atelectasis seen on follow-up X-rays. On the fifth day after extubation, new hazy opacity in the right perihilar region. On the sixth day, increased opacification of lungs; bilateral pleural effusions observed 16 hours later. Overall, progressive worsening of atelectasis and pulmonary edema.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal segmental anatomy, preserved biventricular systolic function (LVEF 69%), patent foramen ovale and ductus arteriosus with left-to-right shunting.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: On the sixth day, concentric biventricular hypertrophy noted, with preserved biventricular function (LVEF 61%), small pericardial effusion, and no shunting across the ductus arteriosus.
